summary: This is a discovery letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to defense counsel in the case of United States v. Tova Noel, providing additional materials related to the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's death. The letter details the production of emails from MCC employee accounts, FBI memoranda, evidence records, and other documents, many of which are classified as confidential under a protective order.

persons.name: Jason E. Foy
persons.context: Attorney representing Tova Noel, recipient of this discovery letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office.

persons.name: Tova Noel
persons.context: Named defendant in the criminal case referenced (United States v. Tova Noel), appears to be an MCC employee based on the context of the discovery materials.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Subject of a BOP psychological reconstruction memorandum and keyword searches in MCC employee emails related to his death.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: Signatory of the discovery letter as the Acting U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York.

connections.description: Foy is the defense attorney representing defendant Tova Noel, as indicated by the letter being addressed to him regarding her case.
Noel was an MCC employee, and the discovery includes emails and records related to Epstein's incarceration and death, suggesting a custodial or supervisory connection.

events.title: MCC Watch Call
events.description: A watch call log from the Metropolitan Correctional Center for August 9, 2019, produced as part of discovery.

events.description: A watch call log from the Metropolitan Correctional Center for August 10, 2019, produced as part of discovery.

events.title: Email Account Copying
events.description: Approximately 45,000 emails and attachments from 24 MCC employee email accounts were copied and provided to the government.

events.title: BOP Psychological Reconstruction of Epstein
events.description: The Bureau of Prisons produced a memorandum titled 'Psychological Reconstruction of Jeffrey Epstein'.

events.title: Protective Order Entered
events.description: A protective order was entered in the case of United States v. Tova Noel, governing the disclosure of discovery materials.

locations: Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office produced approximately 45,000 emails from 24 MCC employee accounts, copied around August 19, 2019, using keywords including 'Epstein' and 'suicide'.
A Bureau of Prisons memorandum titled 'Psychological Reconstruction of Jeffrey Epstein' dated September 17, 2019, was produced as confidential discovery.
MCC watch call logs for August 9 and 10, 2019—dates closely following Epstein's death—were included in the production.
All produced materials are subject to a protective order from December 16, 2019, restricting public disclosure.
The discovery is part of the criminal case United States v. Tova Noel (No. 19 Cr. 830), indicating legal proceedings against an MCC employee related to Epstein's death.
